Item 8.01 - Other Events.content: This Form 8-K provides an update regarding the Share Purchase Agreement for the acquisition of Wolt Enterprises Oy and includes supplemental disclosures that amend and supplement the prospectus previously filed.

subsections.Amendment to the Share Purchase Agreemen: As previously announced, on November 9, 2021, DoorDash, Inc. (“DoorDash”), Wolt Enterprises Oy (“Wolt”), and Mikko Kuusi, as the representative of Wolt’s securityholders, entered into a Share Purchase Agreement (the “Original Share Purchase Agreement”). On April 9, 2022, the parties entered into an amendment (the “Amendment”) to the Original Share Purchase Agreement. The purposes of the amendment include: (i) revising the consideration allocation mechanics to accommodate liquidation preference provisions of Wolt’s stockholders’ agreements and articles of association, and (ii) revising the treatment of Vested Wolt Options to provide that upon Closing, each Vested Wolt Option will be cancelled and the holder will receive either a substitute vested option to purchase DoorDash Class A common stock (for continuing Wolt employees) or shares of DoorDash Class A common stock (for non-continuing Wolt employees). The parties also agreed to updated forms of the lockup agreement and joinder agreement. Copies of the Amendment, the Lockup Agreement, and the Joinder Agreement are filed as exhibits to this Form 8-K.
subsections.Supplemental Disclosure: This Form 8-K updates, amends and supplements the prospectus (the “Prospectus”) included in the Registration Statement on Amendment No. 1 to Form S-4, File No. 333-261844, filed by DoorDash with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the “SEC”) on February 24, 2022 and declared effective by the SEC on February 28, 2022. The information contained in this Form 8-K and its exhibits is incorporated by reference into the Prospectus. To the extent that information in this Form 8-K differs from or updates information in the Prospectus, the information in this Form 8-K shall supersede or supplement the information in the Prospectus. The following defined terms used in the Prospectus and this supplemental disclosure shall be amended to have the following meanings: all references to the “Share Purchase Agreement” or “Annex A” shall refer to the Original Share Purchase Agreement as amended by the Amendment; all references to the “Lockup Agreement” or “Annex C” shall refer to the form of Lockup Agreement attached as Exhibit 2.2; all references to the “Joinder Agreement” or “Annex D” shall refer to the form of Joinder Agreement attached as Exhibit 2.3; all references to terms not otherwise defined herein shall have the meaning ascribed in the Prospectus; and all terms defined in this supplemental disclosure shall have the meanings ascribed herein.
subsections.Prospectus Amendments - Cover Letter: The first eight paragraphs of the cover letter to the Prospectus are amended, restated and supplemented to reflect the Amendment to the Share Purchase Agreement dated April 9, 2022. The updated text details the terms of the purchase of Wolt shares and options in exchange for DoorDash Class A common stock, including the treatment of Wolt Preferred Shares and the calculation of the 'Per Share Closing Stock Consideration' and 'Liquidation Preference Top-Up Shares'. The Total Share Consideration is defined as 39,382,172 shares of DoorDash Class A common stock, subject to Consideration Adjustments based on Wolt's cash, expenses, debt, and other items. The exchange rate for these adjustments will be based on the 'Closing Euro Exchange Rate'. The letter also notes that certain key employees of Wolt entered into stock restriction agreements, subjecting 40% of their consideration to a four-year time-based vesting schedule.
subsections.Prospectus Amendments - Q&A Section: The section of the Prospectus entitled 'QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE TRANSACTION' is supplemented as follows: a. The disclosure under 'Why am I receiving this prospectus?' is amended to include reference to the April 9, 2022 Amendment. b. The disclosure under 'What will Wolt securityholders receive in the Transaction?' is amended to detail the revised consideration structure, including the Per Share Closing Stock Consideration, the treatment of Wolt Preferred Shares, the calculation of the Total Share Consideration (starting at 39,382,172 shares), and the definition of key terms like 'Acquiror Share Closing Trading Price'. c. The disclosure under 'Is any portion of the consideration otherwise payable to Wolt securityholders being subject to re-vesting?' is amended to clarify that 40% of the consideration for certain key employees is subject to a four-year vesting schedule. d. The disclosure under 'Is any portion of the consideration otherwise payable to Wolt securityholders being held back for the satisfaction of indemnification claims?' is amended to detail the establishment of the 'Indemnity Escrow Fund' with 2,250,409 shares and a potential 'True-Up Escrow Fund' to handle indemnification and purchase price adjustments.
subsections.Prospectus Amendments - Summary Section: The section of the Prospectus entitled 'SUMMARY' is supplemented as follows: a. The disclosure under 'Parties to the Share Purchase Agreement—Sellers' is amended to state that Wolt shareholders who execute a Joinder Agreement become a Seller. b. The first three paragraphs under 'The Transaction and the Share Purchase Agreement' are amended to reflect the updated process, including the use of a Drag-Along Exercise if not all shareholders voluntarily sign a Joinder Agreement. c. The bulleted disclosures under 'Conditions to the Completion of the Transaction' are amended to specify the conditions related to receiving Joinder Agreements from at least 95% of securityholders (Supermajority Securityholders) and ultimately 100% of shareholders, and the cancellation of all Wolt options. d. The disclosure under 'The Support Agreements' is amended to note that Supporting Stockholders entered into an acknowledgement agreement regarding the Amendment. e. The disclosure under 'The Joinder Agreements' is amended to clarify the process and legal effect of the Joinder Agreements, including for shareholders brought in via the Drag-Along Exercise.
subsections.Prospectus Amendments - Risk Factors (Tr: The section of the Prospectus entitled 'RISK FACTORS—Risks Related to the Transaction' is supplemented as follows: a. The risk factor 'The share consideration is calculated based on a fixed number of shares...' is amended and restated to reflect the updated consideration mechanics, including the Total Share Consideration of 39,382,172 shares plus or minus adjustments, and the potential for Liquidation Preference Top-Up Shares. b. The risk factor 'Wolt shareholders and Wolt Vested Optionholders will have a significantly lower ownership and voting interest...' is amended to state that former Wolt securityholders are expected to own approximately 9.5% of outstanding DoorDash Class A common stock post-transaction. c. A new risk factor is inserted stating that 'Holders of Stock-Eligible Vested Wolt Options who fail to timely execute the Optionholder Acknowledgement and Waiver will not be entitled to receive any consideration...'
subsections.Prospectus Amendments - Risk Factors (Po: The section of the Prospectus entitled 'RISK FACTORS—Risks Relating to DoorDash and Wolt after Completion of the Transaction' is supplemented as follows: a. The risk factor 'The shares of DoorDash Class A common stock to be received by Wolt shareholders...' is amended and restated to clarify that upon closing, the rights of former Wolt securityholders will be governed by DoorDash's certificate of incorporation and bylaws.
subsections.Prospectus Amendments - Risk Factors (Wo: The section of the Prospectus entitled 'RISK FACTORS—Risks Relating to Wolt’s Business' is supplemented by inserting a new risk factor: 'The conflict between Russia and Ukraine and its impact, including the related sanctions and export controls, could adversely affect Wolt’s results of operations.' This new risk factor details potential negative impacts such as discontinuing relationships with partners, product availability issues, payment restrictions, increased compliance and fuel costs, and disruption to supply chains and financial markets.
subsections.Prospectus Amendments - The Transaction: The section of the Prospectus entitled 'THE TRANSACTION' is supplemented as follows: a. The disclosure under 'Structure of the Transaction' is amended to reiterate the process for all Wolt shareholders to become party to the Share Purchase Agreement via Joinder Agreements, including through the Drag-Along mechanism. b. The disclosure under 'Indemnification' is amended to detail that Indemnifying Parties will indemnify DoorDash for various losses. The 'Indemnity Escrow Available Recourse' will be the primary source for compensation. Indemnification payments are subject to a de minimis threshold of €750,000 per loss and an aggregate deductible of €25 million, with exceptions for fundamental representations and fraud. The total recourse is limited to the consideration received by each Indemnifying Party.
subsections.Prospectus Amendments - The Share Purcha: The section of the Prospectus entitled 'THE SHARE PURCHASE AGREEMENT' is supplemented as follows: a. The disclosure under 'The Transaction' is amended to reflect the updated process involving Support Agreements, Joinder Agreements, and the Drag-Along Exercise. b. The disclosure under 'Treatment of Wolt Securities; Purchase Price Consideration and Adjustments' is amended and restated to provide a comprehensive overview of the updated treatment of Wolt shares and options, the calculation of consideration including the base of 39,382,172 shares, and post-closing adjustments. It provides a preliminary estimate that the Per Share Closing Stock Consideration would be approximately 0.059, meaning 1 DoorDash share for every 17-18 Wolt shares. c. The disclosure under 'Escrow Fund; Indemnity Escrow Available Recourse' is amended to detail the mechanics of the Indemnity Escrow Fund (containing 2,250,409 shares) and the potential True-Up Escrow Fund. d. The disclosure under 'Fractional Shares' is amended to state that the number of shares issued to each Seller will be aggregated and rounded up to the nearest whole number. e. The bulleted disclosures under 'Conditions to Completion of the Transaction' are amended to align with the updated requirements for Joinder Agreements and the acquisition of Supermajority Securities. f. The third paragraph under 'Indemnification' is amended to restate the thresholds and limits for indemnification claims, including the €750,000 per-loss threshold and €25 million aggregate deductible.
subsections.Prospectus Amendments - Ancillary Agreem: The section of the Prospectus entitled 'ANCILLARY AGREEMENTS' is supplemented as follows: a. The disclosure under 'The Support Agreements' is amended to note that Supporting Stockholders entered into an acknowledgement agreement regarding the Amendment. b. The disclosure under 'The Joinder Agreements' is amended to reflect the updated form of the agreement and clarify its terms, including for shareholders subject to the Drag-Along Exercise.
subsections.Forward-Looking Statements: This supplement contains forward-looking statements regarding the timing, completion, and expected benefits of the proposed acquisition of Wolt. These statements are subject to risks and uncertainties, including the ability to consummate the transaction, integration risks, unexpected costs, the effect of the announcement on business relationships, and general economic conditions. Readers are urged not to place undue reliance on these statements and to refer to the 'Risk Factors' section of the Prospectus and other SEC filings for more information.
subsections.No Offer or Solicitation: This communication shall not constitute an offer to sell or the solicitation of an offer to buy any securities, nor shall there be any sale of securities in any jurisdiction in which such offer, solicitation or sale would be unlawful prior to registration or qualification under the securities laws of any such jurisdiction. No offering of securities shall be made except by means of a prospectus meeting the requirements of Section 10 of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and, where applicable, the requirements under the securities laws of any other applicable jurisdiction.
subsections.Important Additional Information Has Bee: DoorDash has filed with the SEC a registration statement on Form S-4, which includes a prospectus of DoorDash. INVESTORS ARE URGED TO CAREFULLY READ THE PROSPECTUS IN ITS ENTIRETY AND OTHER RELEVANT DOCUMENTS TO BE FILED WITH THE SEC IN THEIR ENTIRETY WHEN THEY BECOME AVAILABLE BECAUSE THEY WILL CONTAIN IMPORTANT INFORMATION ABOUT DOORDASH, WOLT, THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION AND RELATED MATTERS. Investors may obtain free copies of the prospectus and other documents filed with the SEC through the website maintained by the SEC at www.sec.gov and on DoorDash’s website at ir.doordash.com.

subsections.Exhibits List: Exhibit 2.1: Amendment to the Share Purchase Agreement, dated as of April 9, 2022, by and among DoorDash, Inc., Wolt Enterprises Oy and Mikko Kuusi, as the Securityholder Representative. Exhibit 2.2: Form of Lockup Agreement by and between DoorDash, Inc. and each of the parties named in each agreement therein. Exhibit 2.3: Form of Joinder Agreement by and between DoorDash, Inc. and each of the parties named in each agreement therein. Exhibit 104: Cover Page Interactive Data File (embedded within the Inline XBRL document).
